reviews.text: An inexpensive hotel that would pass easily as a three star property in Europe. Good room which are well decorated with decent sized bathroom. Try and get an upper floor for the best views. We were on floor 22 so we could see over the Hudson river and in to Jersey. Location near to Subway and the excellant Zabar's deli and coffee shop. No better place for breakfast in New York.
reviews.title: Good Place

reviews.text: Just returned from a week at the Beacon Hotel. Excellent hotel, location and staff. Planning second trip already and will definately be returning to this hotel. Highly recommend room 1909 completely refurbished, only downside faces Fairway market which can be quite noisy during the early hours when deliveries are being made, not good if your a light sleeper like me. We did tried Vinnies pizzeria as recommended on tripadvisor, never go there again worst pizza I have ever had. Plenty of other great restuarants to choose from and your never faraway from Starbucks which is always good news. We were there for the St Patricks day parade which was fantastic. Next trip planned for fall to see Central Park in all its glory. This hotel is so close to Central Park that we walked through it everyday, its amazing.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Service
definitely loved beacon
reviews.text: we stayed at beacon for 3 nights and i must say we really loved it.previous reviews on this hotel made us decide to try it this time and they were right..the room was big with 2 double beds and the kitchenette is a big plus.the room was cleaned everyday,so no problems in that as well.our room was a smooking room( not our choice though) ,but it didnt smell the single bit.it was the same as a nonsmoking one. the hotel's location was great,we usually stay in times sq. area but we really liked the neighbourhood.the fairway is just across the street, a starbucks on the corner and a lot of different options around.we wld definitely come back to this hotel.

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: My husband and I had fantastic time at Beacon and in New York. We were there for 4 nights Feb 9-13 2006 and were thrilled to experience the biggest ever recorded snowfall in New York - 27 inches in Central Park!

Had researched many hotels and reviews before booking and can confirm Beacon is one of best deals. Hotel clean, warm, heating works! Rooms massive - 2 double beds. Powerful shower with plenty of hot water at midnight when we arrived. Kitchenette etc all as per other reviews, great! Reception staff accommodating. We arrived late and although I had previously e-mailed to request non-smoking room these are allocated on arrival so we had smoking room 1st night. However, there was no evidence of its use as a smoking room - smell and condition of room no different to non-smoking room we were swiftly moved to for rest of our stay. So if arriving late would advise telephone beforehand. Don't use hotel phones - we didn't, but got a $5(£3) phonecard which gave us over 3 hours uk landline calltime! You can use card in public hotel phones on 2nd floor. Once you have dialled number, you are told how much calltime you have.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, great location

reviews.text: The hotel Beacon was still being refurbished when we checked in on the 25th of August. Virgin informed me that the work was running behind schedule but would be completed by 31st of August - it wasn't and they still had floors 1 through 7 to complete. My husband and I went to NY with 6 friends and out of the 4 couples only 1 was initially give a refurbished room. We did complain and they were helpful and moved the rest of us on the following day. So when you book in if you're given a room on floors 1 through 7 ask for a higher floor. The lower floors are clean but very very tired and in need of quite a lot of work. Apart from that the Beacon is in a really good location and is situated between the 72nd and 79th subway stations so getting around NY is easy and cheap. A single trip being $2 on the subway. If you're planning to use the subway get a metro ticket as the most economical way to travel. If you want a really excellent, and cheap breakfast you must go to Big Niks - the décor leaves a lot to be desired but the food and staff are excellent. An excellent place for an evening meal is Niko's and if you tell then you're staying at the Beacon you even get 10% discount from the bill. The Vind Cafe is ok and right next door to the hotel - the foods good and plentiful but the service is dire and they add a huge service charge on the bill.
reviews.title: Bit out of town but has good subway links and close to some good food outlets

likes.liked: — The rooms were bigger than the average in New York and good location to sub way
likes.disliked: — Having to be asked to be moved to a new refurbished room

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at the Beacon Hotel in a 1 bedroom suite. It cost a little more but it included a kitchenette which we found handy. There was a great supermarket and handy food outlets accross the road. There were also several choices of basic restaurants around the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the room to be clean, spacious and the bed extremely comfortable. The in-room safe was a little small so we had a slight inconvenience to place our laptop with the Concierge each day. All the staff were friendly and attentive when ever we needed to ask for assistance.
reviews.title: Loved it! Will be back one day!

reviews.text: We found the location terrific as it was away from the hustle and bustle of downtown but only a 5 minute walk to the subway which was a perfect way for us to explore New York City.
reviews.title: Awesome, worth every penny. Highly recommend the Hotel Beacon

reviews.text: The photograph's of this place on the net do not do it justice. We stayed on the 18th floor in a newly renovated room which was absolutely lovely. As first timers to New York we quickly found out that it was a great neighbourhood to be staying in. Close to 72nd st station, the park, museums and of course, close to the theatre's. After a 21 hour flight from Sydney it was a very comfortable place to stay with everything in the room you could need. Can't wait to go back to New York. At least we know where we will be staying.
reviews.title: Great location in a great neighborhood - Our favorite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, daughter and I stayed in a one bedroom suite. It was perfect. There was so much space - it was like having a small apartment. The rooms were large and it was great having a small, fully equipped kitchenette for breakfast and snacks. I was impressed by the size of the rooms for a NY hotel and so much light. The closets were huge! The hotel was conveniently located near restaurants, markets and the subway. The Ocean Cafe nearby was a great find and I loved the Fairway Market. I would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Good value for a very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was recently renovated and is beautifully done. It is located on the Upper West Side and is across the street from the Fairway market which is one the greatest grocery stores. The hotel rooms come with complete kitchen. We really enjoyed our stay here.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed at this hotel for two weeks.. and it turned out to be a great location for our holiday.. just up from subway which we used all the time and it was ideal for us.... staff were very helpful and pleasent... even met a fellow thin lizzy fan at reception which was good omen! ha.... lovely views from the hotel room at nite too.... very clean.. quiet.. ( except when some jerk decided to start playing his trumpet at early hours of sunday morning.. i phoned reception but nobody arrived .. small gripe though)... laundry room was bonus... and great wee cafe rite beside hotel.. being so close to central park and john lennons old place was bonus too! if you dont wanna be located in heart of city.. and would welcome quieter area at nite.. i would highly recommend this hotel..
reviews.title: great place to stay if you dont wanna be slap bang in city centre....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Hotel Beacon with a sense of expectation that this would be a hotel that was a cut above the rest and we were not disappointed. We were staying for 8 nights and were lucky enough to be upgraded to a one bedroom suite - roomy and well appointed with all you need. The service was great and we found the staff were professional and helpful with everything we needed including all the little things that make a difference. The upper West Side neighbourhood is wonderful after a hard day pounding the NY pavements with loads of great restaurants within easy walking distance with fabulous delis, supermarket and bottle shop across the street.
reviews.title: A great hotel that certaintly lived up to expectations

reviews.text: This hotel was a splendid place to stay. We were lucky enough to have a very comfortable suite. As it was well equipped with fridge,cooker and microwave. Also the most fantastic mega market was just across the street. The fresh fruit displays need to be seen to be believed.
reviews.title: Train Across America (First stop)
Great location & hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Beacon for a week in early June 2004 with my husband and 2 friends. We had a quad share room and it had ample space for 4 people. Kitchenette was really helpful. Great location opposite 24 food market. Loads of fantastic restaurants around the hotel. Very close to subway stations. Would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: The Beacon Hotel, a little treasure
reviews.text: My daughter selected the Beacon as our "home away from home" for the 8 days we visited NYC. The hotel is perfectly located - close to the subway, close to Central Park and the museums, and close to food stores. The kitchenette in the room meant we could have our morning coffee and rolls in our pj's while we planned the day's activities. The hotel is clean, staff is friendly and helpful. We will definitely return!

reviews.title: Excellent - will stay again
reviews.text: This was a great choice, which I decided on after reading other reviews on this site. My husband and I, and our two young children (4 and 1) stayed at the Hotel Beacon for 5 nights. The kitchen-ette with a stove, microwave, refrigerator and even dishes was great - especially with a huge grocery store across the steet. The staff was very friendly and even accomodated us with a late check-out. They have a small computer lab with internet access and printers. You can buy tickets for various attractions and even subway passes at the desk. Less than a block from the subway and very easy to hail a cab. A couple blocks from Central Park, an easy walk to the Natural History Museum and only a couple blocks from a children's museum.

reviews.title: 4day trip to NYC
reviews.text: Wil most definitely stay at the Beacon again!!!!! Excellent experience at a great price. Look on the net for prices at a steal...especially for a NYC hotel!

reviews.title: Great for the budget traveler
reviews.text: We found NYC. to be friendly and busy. The hotel Beacon was great. It was both friendly and located in a great area.

We stayed at the Beacon hotel from Feb. 20th till 23rd and would recommend it to anyone who likes to visit New York and not pay too much for designer hotels, rooftop pools etc. We liked having a kitchenette in our room to make coffee and toast in the morning and to keep some cold drinks for our evening rituals before going out at night. The room was larger than expected, the bathroom was rather tiny though.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great rooms.

reviews.text: Very important (for me as a Dutch shopper), within walking distance you will find Victoria's secret, Sephora, Pottery Barn, Urban Outfitters and Barnes & Noble and at Columbus mall: J Crew etc....for all the stuff you won't find in Europe.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location

reviews.text: We stayed here from the 15th Feb to the 19th Feb 2006. The hotel is in a good location, only 2 blocks away from the subway. We stayed in room 1909, which had recently been decorated, the rooms here are much bigger than any other room i have stayed in new york, with the bonus of a fridge and cooker. Fairways supermarket is right across the street. Over all a great stay was had, and i have already booked to stay here again in the summer..
reviews.title: Great hotel!!

reviews.text: I stayed at The Beacon from 10th to 14th February. It's a great hotel and I highly recommned it. It is on the Upper West Side, a few minutes walk from a subway which will take you to the busy areas (Times Sqaure etc) within a few minutes.
reviews.title: Don't tell everyone !
Fantastic place to stay
reviews.text: My room was huge with fantastic views over the city on two sides of the room. It was room 2412. The little kitchette was great and well stocked with items. It's great if your on a budget and want to cook something light in the evening or for breakfast rather than eating out. There is a wonderful supermarket ouver the road listed in a few guide books - called Fairways. It was great for bagels etc if you want to self cater.

I travel to NY at leats one time a year since 15 years and this was my first stay in this hotel. I found it great. Very, very nice room (a one bedroom suite for a family of 4, a couple and 2 kids) and an excellent neighborhood.
reviews.title: We will be back!

reviews.text: We will be back!
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with a friend in a one bedroom suite for five nights last month and it was a fantastic hotel. We had a pull out sofabed in the living room and a seperate bathroom so we could both have privacy. We emailed ahead before we booked and had a very nice reply saying that they could make sure that we would have a room with a bathroom off of the hallway but that if would be on a lower floor. This was perfect and we were on the 12th floor anyway.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was fantastic, only a couple of minutes from the subway (which was very safe) and as many other reviewers have said a wonderful market opposite which we frequently used.
reviews.title: A real gem of an apartment hotel located in Upper Westside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly without being pushy, helping us to get bus tour tickets, and the room was great. The kitchen was very handy and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The only thing I can think of to improve the room was that the toilet seat was cheap plastic and didn't really suit the nice bathroom.
reviews.title: Well-located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a week's stay at Hotel Beacon and what a great hotel it is.
reviews.title: Little Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time in New York and we really enjoyed our stay there. The room was very big I believe by NY standards and the bathroom too - I have stayed in far tinier places in Europe.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else, now...

likes.liked: — Clean, spacious, well situated, great view from our room

reviews.text: We primarily choose the hotel for location and also the fact that it had a kitchenette in the room.The decor in the hotel is a bit dated and could do with a revamp but this didn't bother us.
reviews.title: Go to a big chain, not worth the headache to stay here

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is perfect - subway within less than 5 mins walking distance and a block away from Central Park. The neighbourhood is very nice and always felt safe. Loads of fab restaurants to choose from and then there is the Fairway market across from the hotel - just go in to see this place!!! Upstairs at night there is a steakhouse and it's very informal.
reviews.title: Faded Grandeur

likes.liked: — Convenient location, wonderful views, excellent value
likes.disliked: — Could probably do with a refurb.

reviews.text: There was complimentary newspaper every morning and the staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Beacon

reviews.text: Stayed at Beacon Oct 30 to Nov 3. Second time. Excellent rooms, good size, lovely comfortable beds. Good bathroom shower etc.
reviews.title: Beacon Hotel, well kept secret.
Perfect for us and the kids
reviews.text: Staff very pleasant and helpful, unlike some reviews stated. Only gripe was lack of sufficient coffee in room to enable use of coffee maker! Reception staff provided more when asked but i would have expected cleaners to replenish. Small thing i know. Everything else great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Subway a block away, easy access to everywhere. Central Park 5 minutes walk. Amsterdam Avenue, parallel with Broadway, some excellent restaurants. Dined at Nice Matin, really good food. Wine list 20 pages, one bottle listed at $14000. Need i say more.
reviews.title: Really good hotel, clean, reasonably priced and very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lively bars, good fun area of NY.
reviews.title: fantastic city and a great hotel

reviews.text: Manhattan Diner a block north, wonderful breakfast at really good price. Packed out all day, says it all. The two egg special with ham, potato hash, squeezed juice, toast and as usual gallons of coffee. Perfect.
reviews.title: My new favorite NYC hotel
The Beacon: We loved it -- again!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Beacon for the second time (first time was in 2002), and we loved it again. The room was clean, comfortable, and relatively spacious, everything worked well, a request for an extra towel and more tissues was fulfilled in minutes, and the location is superb. It's a block to the subway and just a short walk from great restaurants, Barnes & Noble, movie theaters, and Central Park, and most importantly, it is across the street from the wonderful Fairway Market. The kitchenette seals the deal: it's a great value for a family wanting to "eat in" to save money on meals. Look for their specials on their website; our room was $170/night before taxes and was perfectly comfortable for four people.

reviews.title: Loved the view and the location
reviews.text: My wife and I flew in from Oslo, Norway, for a 6 day easterbreak and found the hotel without any trouble (great about New York numbered streets). All of a sudden we found ourselves in a room on the 25.th floor, view of the park and all the hihgrise you could need. No breakfast (but who needs it in NY), perfect service, nice and clean big rooms and smart kitchen solution. The best place I have stayed in so far in NY. Coming back to Beacon for sure.

reviews.title: Great Hotel in Fab Location
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights - hotel was brilliant, slap bang in the middle of upper west side. Loads locally and only a 10 minute walk from central park. Good diners and eateries nearby - would definitely go back.

reviews.title: Would stay here again
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and extremely helpful Just grand!

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, upgraded our room
reviews.text: Stayed here with my sister and daughter for five nights. We had booked a triple room and were initially disappointed to find just two standard size (4'6" wide) double beds. We were offered an upgrade to a suite for an extra $70 per night which we declined. However, our room, though not overly large, was comfortable, warm, clean and quiet, as it was at the rear of the building on 14th floor. Cannot fault the facilities in the room, as mentioned in previous reviews. Staying here is like having your own appartment in New York. The neighbourhood feels safe and the local shop and restaurant staff very friendly. Excellent weekday breakfast specials at the Viand Cafe next door and good evening meals. Also enjoyed the Fairway across the road for breakfasts and dinner, and groceries. Plentiful restaurants and cafes adjacent which cater for the locals and therefore don't charge tourist prices. This location is great for using the subway and a Metro Card will take you all over the city. If you like walking, it's a pleasant half hour stroll through Central Park to 5th Avenue and all the shops. Reception staff efficient and friendly. The concierge arranged a shuttle back to the airport costing $21 per person, and stored our luggage after check-out.

reviews.title: Beacon Hotel: the scoop
reviews.text: great manhattan location: 1/2 blk from subway, full service supermarket across the street. Clean 2 star quality (motel6 like) rooms. Kitchenette is tiny but super convenient.

reviews.title: great!
reviews.text: Great hotel for New York city. We stayed in a suite with double beds. Large rooms, very comfortable for 3 adults and one child. Transortation was easy with the subway station only a few blocks away. The beds were a little lumpy but that was our only complaint! I will definteley stay here again.

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.text: WHEN: Stayed May 7-12. Two adults.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: ROOM: Guestroom with double beds and kitchenette

reviews.title: We will be back!
reviews.text: FIRST IMPRESSION: Room isn't your upscale type of hotel room but it isn't your Motel 6 either. It definitely is bigger than your budget NYC hotel room. Good size for the price. Didn't have a view but faced the sidestreet; didn't have any noise from the street like I've read. We slept well through the nights. Perhaps the rooms facing Broadway Avenue may have had more noise? The carpet looked a bit dingy. The beds were comfortable; firm. Small table with two chairs provided. Dresser with two larger drawers. TV with cable. Shades that you could roll up or down by simply pulling on a cord. AC worked well. Alarm clock available. Iron and board in small closet.

Several friends from around the country met in New York from September 16th through 21st. Three of us stayed at the Hotel Beacon, and we couldn't have been happier. We had a suite with two double beds and a hide a bed in the livingroom. There were two very nice size closets, one in the bedroom and one in the hall. Both the bedroom and the living room were large with wonderful views overlooking the Hudson River.
reviews.title: Perfect home away from home
Fantastic
reviews.text: The kitchenette had a stove, oven, toaster, coffee pot, microwave and apartment size refrigerator, as well as cups, plates, utinsels, and dish towels. The bathroom was nicely appointed, and the rooms were clean and fresh. We called for extra towels (women, you know need a lot of towels) and they were quickly brought up. There was no noise between rooms at all, you couldn't tell there was anyone else on the floor. We requested non-smoking, and the room was truly that - no old smoke odors at all, in fact none in the hall either.

reviews.title: Great !
reviews.text: The elevators were clean and fast, and the staff was very nice and courteous. We couldn't have asked for a nicer place from which to venture out - The Beacon is close to everything - subway, shops, restaurant, park, and historic buildings, and it truly was a home away from home. We can't wait to return!

reviews.title: very nice
reviews.text: This is my second visit here (first in 2001). I cannot fault Hotel Beacon. The first time we stayed here we had a suite, this time we had a standard room. They were clean and everything was in working order. Unfortunately the walls are a bit thin and our neighbours tended to stay up late talking rather loud.

reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Beacon
reviews.text: Location is great. Walked to Times Square. Supermarkets are across the road and very handy. Had breakfast only once at the attached restaurant downstairs.

My wife and I booked a week in August through Virgin Atlantic and chose the Beacon as it seemed to offer good value for money and had good reviews, and we weren't disappointed. Although our room wasn't the largest it was exceptionally clean and quiet with a superb kitchenette area that had all the equipment you could need. The room occupied a corner on the 23rd floor and the view made up for it's size as you could look out with a clear view to the tree tops of Central Park and beyond. Considering we were in the middle of a vibrant city It was all very relaxing.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.text: The staff are friendly and obliging and we could not find any fault.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Would recommend it for everyone

likes.liked: — Kitchenette with great facilities - saved on restaurants

reviews.title: Fantastic!!
reviews.text: The lack of an onsite restaurant is not an issue as the Viand Cafe next door opens at 6:30 and shuts late. It has an extensive menu and provides breakfasts that will set you up for the day. If you were of a lazy disposition you could eat here all week and not finish the menu.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be sure to go to the Fairway supermarket opposite, it's everything a food store should be.
reviews.title: can't wait to go back

likes.disliked: — theater under renovation, would love to have seen a show there

reviews.text: I took my parents to NY to celebrate 50 years of marriage so naturally only wanted the best for them. We booked the hotel through our travel agent, after reading previous reviews first.
reviews.title: Great time in Beacon hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being very familiar with NYC and traveling there often; the Beacon is a very good choice for a short or extended stay. The location is excellent on the Upper Westside close enough to midtown for tourists/business but far enough away to enjoy a neighborhood feel. Endless choices for restaurants between Columbus, Broadway and Amsterdam; good shopping choices, close to Central Park and all the excellent museums/Lincoln Center/Greenmarkets/Columbus Circle etc. Transporation is close with 1-2-3 lines within two short blocks and A & C two long blocks away. Area is very safe. Starbucks right next door, local diners for decent breakfast, Crumbs cupcakes within a block, Fairway across the street to stock up if you are the room cooking type - what more do you need?
reviews.title: Solid choice in city of endless choices

reviews.text: The hotel itself provides kitchenettes with every room configuration from doubles, to king to suites. Nice to have the good size refer, counter room, and warming up your take out possibilities. Includes all appliances, dishes, silverware etc.
reviews.title: Perfect for families, good quality hotel

reviews.text: We had a king room, it was spacious enough for two, bed was comfortable, good dresser space, large closet (no safe). Bathrooms were exceptionally clean marble, updated (maybe a bit small for some in the king room - but just fine really - unless you have a need to spread out). We were pretty close to the elevator, but room was still very quiet - room to room noise was minimal.
reviews.title: This hotel exceeded my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good choice for many reasons - location, cleanliness, comfort. Makes paying NYC prices more comfortable too.
reviews.title: Tremendous value

reviews.text: Staff was nice, very helpful and pleasant. Taxi's abounded at the front door (if you must).
reviews.title: outstanding

reviews.text: This hotel was in the best location, down the street from the subway, close to Central park and everything witin walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I would recomend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the city, but not pay the price! This hotel was a great price for what you get. The best part was the kitchenet.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for family vacation

reviews.text: The morning staff were a little bit on the rude side, (the check in staff) but the nighttime crew and HOUSEKEEPING (day and night) were amazing!!! I have never been to a hotel before (and I travel a lot) who's house keeping were to friendly! That is all I talked about how amazing our housekeeper was!
reviews.title: Soon to be a gem in NYC

reviews.text: Besided that
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great surroundings

likes.disliked: — The staff could be more friendly

reviews.text: We stayed at the Beacon for 5 nights in July. We were so happy with our 23rd floor one-bedroom suite. The accommodations were clean, spacious (for 2 adults and 2 kids), newly renovated, and had a beautiful view of the NY skyline. We liked having 2 TVs, a fold-out couch for the kids, and a kitchen complete with dishes. Don’t forget your iPod because they have a docking station on the alarm clock. The Beacon is conveniently located across the street from the very large Fairway Market where we went to stock the full-size fridge in the room. The Beacon is just a few blocks away from Central Park and the Subway. Our family would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Spacious and homey with some minor service lapses

likes.liked: — The neighborhood, spacious accomodations especially for New York
likes.disliked: — Paying for Wi-Fi, some staff lapses

reviews.title: A bit run down, but great location
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Beacon in June 2004 and found it a bit more run down than at our last visit in 2001. The furniture and carpeting are shabby and the A/C in one of the rooms did not work. The bathroom, however, was nice and bright and seemed to have been renovated recently. Like the last time, we had a suite and found that the quality of the equipment in the kitchenette had also gone down. But perhaps help is on the way: Major renovation work was going on in the reception area during our stay -- hopefully those efforts will expand to the rest of the hotel.

reviews.title: Nothing special but a good, hotel
reviews.text: These shortcomings are compensated for by the hotel's excellent location on the Upper West Side, 3 blocks from the 72 Street subway station. There is a wonderful market across the street (Fairway) where we bought terrific breakfast and take-out dinner items to save on restaurant expenses. Rooms facing the street have a noise level that can be expected in a big city, but be aware that also rooms facing the courtyard are noisy when there are concerts at the adjacent Beacon Theater.

reviews.title: Quiet but handy for sightseeing
reviews.text: Stayed in the Beacon four nights july 04. The lobby is currently being renovated.

reviews.title: The Beacon is great
reviews.text: I found no problems with this hotel - its in a great location on the Upper West side, convenient to transport and shopping.

reviews.title: Safe, clean, spectacular view
reviews.text: Our room was of a good size and the kitchenette allowed us to save on the cost of breakfast. Rooms are clean and in good condition. Furnishing is nothing special - a bit bland but i guess they have to cater to many varied tastes.

We have just returned from 3 nights at the Beacon. The hotel is very clean, in a great location (close by to many restaurants that are reasonably priced, grocery stores, museums, subway etc..) The staff were very friendly and very keen to please. We have stayed in other more expensive hotels in NY which had much smaller rooms with no kitchentte, and without a doubt, the Beacon is fantastic value for money - with little compromise on quality or service.
reviews.title: Excellent - highly reccomended
Even better than expected
reviews.text: We have just arrived home after spending 5 nights at the excellent Beacon Hotel. We had booked following recommendations read here and were not disappointed, in fact it was even better than we had expected. Our room was spotlessly clean, comfortable and well equipped, the kitchenette was an added bonus. We had great views from the 24th floor toward the Hudson River (spectacular sunsets!)and we found the location of the hotel excellent, a short walk to Central Park or the subway which takes you directly to Times Square. The Fairway Market just opposite was amazing, even for someone who hates shopping, vegetarians are well catered for there so no problem finding my veggie bits and bobs. Absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone wanting value for money and good quality accommodation. We are definitely going back!

We have just arrived home today after 6 wonderful nights spent at the Beacon. We chose it after reading hundreds of hotel reviews on this site, and we were not disappointed. In fact we were thrilled with the size, quality and cleanliness of the rooms, the courtesy of the staff, and the location. It's on the M104 bus route to midtown /Times Square area and 2 mins walk to 72nd St subway station which is on the 1,2 and 3 routes. Every major part of town is accessible from here, including Times Square, Staten Is Ferry, Brooklyn and Bronx. Central park is an easy 10 minute stroll. The neighbourhood has a more laid back feel than the hectic midtown areas, and with plenty of good eateries nearby it's a real winner. If ever we are privileged to visit NY again we shall certainly stay here.
reviews.title: A shining light

reviews.text: We stayed at the Beacon between 19th and 23rd March 2006 based on the reviews given on Travel Advisor. Hotel is very clean it is slightly dated however would definately return. The room had two double beds, a safe, mircowave and fridge. Staff in the hotel more than happy to help. Our flight was not until 21.25, hotel more than happy to store the luggage until we were picked up. You can see the subway station from the hotel, 1 stop to Time Square on the express line. Would recommend Macy's basement for food. Fresh pasta cooked in front of you for $7 - excellent taste and value. 21st Century Department is great for shopping bargains, its diretly across from Ground Zero.
reviews.title: Great Location
Fabulous - Can't recommend it enough!
reviews.text: This hotel is FABULOUS, can't recommend it enough. Having stayed in cramped, not too clean places in midtown the Beacon was a revalation. BIG room, flat screen TV, fully equipped kitchenette, nice bathroom, couldn't have wished for a nicer hotel. Even the view was great, from the 24th floor I could see clean across the Hudson River. Makes a nice change from a grimy brick wall or an air conditioning unit which is usual for NYC! Subway is only a 2 minute walk away, so easy to get to anywhere.
